intro: Ossaea trichocalyx, commonly known as the woolly ossaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it its common name. The plant typically grows in coastal or rocky habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its flowers are small and usually greenish-white, appearing in clusters during the warmer months. Ossaea trichocalyx is often found in fynbos vegetation and is adapted to the region's Mediterranean climate.
